title: A2UI Common Types
description: Common type definitions used across A2UI schemas.

id.description: The unique identifier for this component.

weight.description: The relative weight of this component within a Row or Column. This is similar to the CSS 'flex-grow' property.

oneOf.description: A static list of child component IDs.
A template for generating a dynamic list of children from a data model list. The `componentId` is the component to use as a template.

path.description: The path to the list of component property objects in the data model.

DynamicValue.description: A value that can be a literal, a path, or a function call returning any type.

DynamicString.description: Represents a string that can contain interpolated expressions in the `${expression}` format. Supported expression types include: 1) JSON Pointer paths to the data model (e.g., `${/absolute/path}` or `${relative/path}`), and 2) client-side function calls (e.g., `${now()}`). Function arguments must be literals (quoted strings, numbers, booleans) or nested expressions (e.g., `${formatDate(${/currentDate}, 'MM-dd')}`). To include a literal `${` sequence, escape it as `\${`.

DynamicNumber.description: Represents a value that can be either a literal number, a path to a number in the data model, or a function call returning a number.

DynamicBoolean.description: A boolean value that can be a literal, a path, or a logic expression (including function calls returning boolean).

DynamicStringList.description: Represents a value that can be either a literal array of strings, a path to a string array in the data model, or a function call returning a string array.

FunctionCall.description: Invokes a named function on the client.

call.description: The name of the function to call.

returnType.description: The expected return type of the function call.

LogicExpression.description: A boolean expression used for conditional state (e.g. 'enabled').

CheckRule.description: A single validaton rule applied to an input component.

message.description: The error message to display if the check fails.

Checkable.description: Properties for components that support client-side checks.

checks.description: A list of checks to perform. These are function calls that must return a boolean indicating validity.

path.description: A JSON Pointer to a specific property or object. To maintain data model integrity, paths should use stable unique IDs instead of array indices (e.g., '/genus/f1/name' instead of '/genus/1/name').

value.description: The data value at the specified path. This must not be an array. To represent a list, the value at a path should be an object (map) where each property is a stable ID. Deletion is represented by setting this to null (tombstone).

pos.description: The fractional index position of the object identified by the path. If the path points to a property within an object (e.g., '/genus/f1/name'), pos is usually omitted. If the path points to the object itself (e.g., '/genus/f1'), pos determines its order relative to other sibling IDs.

VersionVector.description: A map where each key is a unique Actor ID and the value is the highest HLC observed from that actor.
